text: The Nicholson Junior KN-2 was an aircraft made in the late 1920s. It was used for flight training in the United States. Only 1 aircraft was built. == Specifications == === General characteristics === * Crew: one * Capacity: one passenger or student * Length: 23 ft (7.0 m) * Wingspan: 37 ft (11 m) * Wing area: 190 sq ft (18 m2) plus 21.5 sq ft (2.00 m2) ailerons * Empty weight: 540 lb (245 kg) * Fuel capacity: 11 US gal (9.2 imp gal; 42 l) * Engine: 1 Ã— Continental A40 flat four or Szekely SR-3 3 cylinder radial engine * Propellers: 2-bladed === Performance === * Maximum speed: 85 mph (137 km/h, 74 kn) * Cruise speed: 75 mph (121 km/h, 65 kn) * Landing speed: 28 mph (45 km/h; 24 kn) * Take-off time: 8 s * Range: 315 mi (507 km, 274 nmi) * Service ceiling: 10,000 ft (3,000 m) Category:American aircraft
title: Nicholson Junior KN-2
